project.teaser: ERA_SHUTLLE is creating a cross-sectoral framework for collaboration and possibilities for talents from different backgrounds to address contemporary health and environmental challenges and produce innovative solutions for the benefit of society. The ERA_SHUTTLE's main goal is...
project.objective: ERA_SHUTLLE is creating a cross-sectoral framework for collaboration and possibilities for talents from different backgrounds to address contemporary health and environmental challenges and produce innovative solutions for the benefit of society. The ERA_SHUTTLE's main goal is to foster R&I capacity in the ERA to benefit the participating widening countries Poland, Croatia, and Malta. This will be accomplished by bolstering R&I support capacities, boosting cross-sectoral collaboration, and implementing cross-sectoral knowledge valorisation and talent circulation experiments while boosting the attractiveness of regional R&I ecosystems. This action is designed by leading research universities from widening countries with underdeveloped RI landscapes and strong non-academic institutions and associations from non-widening countries such as Steinbeis, CERIC-ERIC and ASTP. The ERA_SHUTTLE brings universities, non-academic, and private organisations together to eliminate existing barriers and work toward a common objective by offering training and secondment opportunities that celebrate diversity. Project partners will develop their core capacities and benefit from ERA knowledge and expertise exchange. The project supports industry-research needs by cross-fertilizing ideas to address hurdles and low levels of research valorisation. Following the European Industrial Strategy and the European Skills Agenda, ERA_SHUTTLE will help R&I talents from Widening countries deepen their capacity and broaden their skill set to improve research, knowledge valorisation, and cross-sectoral collaboration. Through specific objectives, project will: identify research institutions' strengths and weaknesses and increase access, integration, and use of research equipment and knowledge, improve research conditions, employability, and career possibilities to attract and retain top research and innovation talent in expanding countries and implement cross-sectoral talent mobilities.
project.title: Accelerating ERA by Sharing Unique Talents for healThy Life and Environment
project.keywords: research and innovation support staff, research and innovation ecosystems in Widening countries, R&I in Health and Environment, capacity building research support

article.title: Boosting research and innovation talent circulation in the health and environment field

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: DMP will provide guidelines on how to identify, collect and manage data generated during the project.

result.title: Progress report
result.description: Progress report as the basis for the technical review meeting.

result.title: Mapping partner’s R&I resources for cross-sectoral collaboration
result.description: Mapping of the R&I support capacities and filtering the collected key research resources that are most relevant for cross-sectoral collaboration in the field of Health & Environment.

result.title: Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan, including revision
result.description: Unified communication plan on use of online and offline channels, and plan for dissemination and exploitation of projects results in other Widening countries and across EU. The plan will be updated in accordance with the project's progress (and at leaste once before the project end).

result.title: Inclusion, gender and ethical requirements
result.description: Inclusion, gender and ethical requirements strategy will ensure that gender equality and ethical requirements are implemented horizontally across all phases of the project.

result.title: Tools for monitoring and evaluation
result.description: Procedures, instruments and tools for collection and analysis of data on activities related to R&I capacities and cross-sectoral collaborations.

result.title: Overview on existing life-long learning tools and career development paths
result.description: Report on existing tools, practices, programmes and structures at the Widening partner institutions.

result.title: Report on secondments 1
result.description: Details on the implementation of the secondment plan, based on the template provided by the European Research Executive Agency (REA)

result.title: Quality manual
result.description: Quality manual will provide guidelines on procedures and rules for the delivery of outputs and implementation of project activities.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
